snippet: Regulatory uncertainty does weigh on banks' ability and desire to make loans. But here are some counterweights to complaints by bankers that new rules are deterring them from making more mortgage loans to consumers.
abstract: Regulatory uncertainty does weigh on banks' ability and desire to make loans. But here are some counterweights to complaints by bankers that new rules are deterring them from making more mortgage loans to consumers.

headline.main: Blaming Regulation, Again, for Restricting Mortgage Lending

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
